279 Harvard St. (at Beacon St.) • 617-566-6660

Put me in your movie!

INT. - BROOKLINE BOOKSMITH - USED BOOK CELLAR - DAY

Used book buyer Natasha prices a pile of books. Awesomely.

<div style="text-align: center;">NATASHA</div>Man, sure is sad when a filmmaker gives up on his dreams and sells a pile of film-making books. But I guess it’s good that someone can get all these awesome, nice-condition books for half price and make some MOVIES.

<div style="text-align: center;">THAT AWESOME MOVIE VOICE-OVER GUY (voice-over)</div><div style="text-align: left;">Who are you talking to? There’s nobody here.</div><div style="text-align: left;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">NATASHA</div><div style="text-align: left;">To the Blog!</div><div style="text-align: left;">
</div><div style="text-align: left;">Natasha begins to type on the computer:</div><div style="text-align: left;">
</div><div style="text-align: center;">NATASHA (voice-over)</div><div style="text-align: left;">These four books we got in the UBC last week sure make it look cheap and easy to put together your very own cinematic masterpiece. Stop by and load up for few ducats and save the rest of your pocket change for lights, cameras and ACTION:</div><div style="text-align: left;">
</div><div style="text-align: left;">
</div><div class="separator" style="clear: both; text-align: center;"></div><div style="text-align: left;">
</div><div style="text-align: left;">The Hollywood Standard by Christopher Riley (used price $10)</div><div style="text-align: left;">Awesomely designed book makes formatting your script properly a no-brainer.</div><div style="text-align: left;">
</div><div style="text-align: left;">How NOT to Write a Screenplay by Denny Martin Flinn (used price $9)</div><div style="text-align: left;">Your masterpiece will win Oscars and make Bergman’s entombed corpse weep. This isn’t amateur hour. Avoid clunky errors by reading this gem. </div><div style="text-align: left;">
</div><div style="text-align: left;">The Shut Up and Shoot Documentary Guide by Anthony Artis (used price $18)</div><div style="text-align: left;">This book is truly impressive. Not very big, full color inside but it seriously goes from 0 (I’ve never held a camera before but I have a compelling idea for a documentary) to 60 (do I pay for Final Cut Pro or hire a pro movie editor?) on making a documentary. Comes with a disc full of extra goodies, too.</div><div style="text-align: left;">
</div><div style="text-align: left;">$30 Film School by Michael W. Dean (used price $15)</div><div style="text-align: left;">The titles is misleading because if you buy this book from us it’s only a FIFTEEN dollar film school! Avoid higher education costs and learn everything in this handy-dandy, easy-to-read volume. It teaches you how to write, light, shoot, edit, distribute your own film and how to get it financed. Or how to finance it yourself. Super practical and very thorough. Also includes a DVD with extras and such.</div>
